page.title: 06Shalford Village Hall
page.content: {Shalford Village Hall}was built in 1925 by order of{Major Guy Gold}of {Abbot's Hall, Shalford,}with the condition that, if it was not required as a hall, it could be converted into two bungalows. There was 4.5 acres of land included. In 1945 the hall and playing field were presented to the people of the village under the control of a committee of eleven.{Major Gold}also donated Â£1,500 for an extension when needed , but part of this money was eventually used to erect a clock tower on the hall in memory of{Captain {Rodney Gold}who was killed in the {Second World War.}The balance of the money contributed to an extension, built in 1970, which included a smaller hall and modern cioakrooms and showers.
